pression $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}}}}$ and express it in simplest radical form in terms of $x$, follow these steps:
Identify the innermost expression and simplify it: $\sqrt{x}$. Since $\sqrt{x} = x^{1/2}$, this step rewrites $\sqrt{x}$ in terms of powers of $x$.

Substitute and simplify the next expression: $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}}$. Replace $\sqrt{x}$ with $x^{1/2}$ to get $\sqrt[3]{x x^{1/2}}$ which simplifies to $\sqrt[3]{x^{3/2}} = (x^{3/2})^{1/3} = x^{1/2}$.

Moving outward, simplify the next layer: $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}}}$. With the previous step, we found $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}} = x^{1/2}$, so replace it to get $\sqrt[3]{x x^{1/2}} = \sqrt[3]{x^{3/2}} = x^{1/2}$.

Simplify the outermost expression: $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}}}}$. From step three, $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}}} = x^{1/2}$, so this simplifies to $\sqrt[3]{x x^{1/2}} = \sqrt[3]{x^{3/2}} = x^{1/2}$.
Conclusion: $\sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt[3]{x \sqrt{x}}}} = x^{1/2}$.
